title: Fixed to rotate in playing.
message:
Fixed to rotate in playing.

How to reproduce this bug is:

1. Play a music.
2. Rotate the tablet.
3. Wait completion of the music.

The bug prevents the activity to show information about a new music (The
player stays showing the old one). The reason of this bug is keeping a
destination of messages. Now the service updates destination always.

title: Fixed the bug on playing after completion.

title: Fixed to work on Android 4.2.2.
message:
Fixed to work on Android 4.2.2.

The main problem is that android.media.MediaPlayer in Android 4.2.2 is
more strict than older one. For old Android, AAP called
MediaPlayer.reset() in any cases with ignoring the status of a
MediaPlayer object. It worked well. But MediaPlayer in Android 4.2.2
does not work for reset() to seek. MediaPlayer requires to call seekTo()
when AAP seeks. Calling seekTo() is needed even when music has been
paused. So now we must know which music a MediaPlayer object handles.

The new version of AAP does not repeat starting and stopping the
service. The service is alive always to memorize the current music.

The bug happened only in playing long music like Internet radio.

to View.setBackgroundColor(). So I decided to change screen design for
unused background color.

list. It shows the directory path of the file list.

message:

jp.gr.java_conf.neko_daisuki.anaudioplayer::

I expect that this link makes development on the shell easy.

title: Fixed one show stopper relating tablet's rotation and messenger.
message:
Fixed one show stopper relating tablet's rotation and messenger.

How to reproduce
================

1. Select a directory.
2. Select a file to play.
3. Pause.
4. Rotate a tablet.
5. Slide the record (or the head).

What I got?
===========

NullPointerException for MainActivity.outgoingMessenger.

Why?
====

When a user rotates a tablet, outgoingMessenger will get null.
MainActivity.onResume() also does not care about it.

Why did not I find this bug?
============================

Even after a user paused music, MainActivity.outgoingMessenger stayed
non-null. And that messenger might be alive. I did not test sliding with
rotating.

title: Fixed not to change time before starting to play a new music.
message:
Fixed not to change time before starting to play a new music.

Pending MSG_WHAT_TIME reponse(s) in the message queue changed time
before starting to play a new music. This patch fixes this bug by
ignoring these response(s) until a MSG_PLAY response.

You can read more at the comment of
IncomingHandler.ignoreWhatTimeUntilPlay().

title: Enhanced to slide a head horizontally.
message:
Enhanced to slide a head horizontally.

1. This patch includes addition of TextViews for title and time. But
TextView for time is not used. Because updating it causes re-layouting.
The head returns to top-left corner on re-layouting.

The uzumaki slider has responsibility to layout the head. So the head
must be a child of the slider. Patch in future will fix them.

2. After releasing the head, the head sometimes moves to most out
position. This is a bug. The reason of it is unknown still.
